title: William Shakespeare - 2 - A Midsummer Night's Dream - Caedmon, 1
description:
Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;
Brief as the lightning in the collied night,
That in a spleen unfolds both heaven and earth,
And ere a man hath power to say, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Behold!Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
The jaws of darkness do devour it up:
So quick bright things come to confusion... 



La Vida es sueno... or a succession of dreams, as evanescent as love in its brilliance and brevity. Each dreamer has his own vision which the playwright interweaves to form the substance of a waking vision.

The Caedmon CDs ripped as mp3s@192. A first-rate cast led by Paul Scofield. The performance scarcely shows its age.
